body.section: A concept is a clinical meaning identified by a unique name. Concepts are formally defined in terms of their relationships with other concepts. These “logical definitions” give explicit meaning which a computer can process and query on. Every concept also has a set of 2 or more terms that name the concept in a human-readable way. In the case of SNOMED-CT, a Fully Specified Name and a Preferred Term must exist for each and every concept, but there can be other descriptions such as synonyms applied to a concept.
